newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico's Salinas insists $84 million fortune clean.
newsitem.headline: Mexico's Salinas insists $84 million fortune clean.

text.p: Raul Salinas de Gortari, the imprisoned brother of former President Carlos Salinas, told Swiss authorities his $84 million in a secret bank account in Switzerland has no connection to drugs, his legal representative Eduardo Luengo said on Tuesday.
Switzerland's chief prosecutor Carla del Ponte questioned Raul Salinas for almost seven hours on Monday at a top-security prison outside Mexico City about the origin of the fortune.
"During the interrogation Mr. Salinas insisted that the money in question has no relationship to drug trafficking or money laundering," Luengo told reporters.
Mexican authorities declined to elaborate on the questioning, for which Del Ponte visited Mexico a third time.

Salinas was arrested in early 1995 on charges of masterminding the murder of a key ruling party leader and of illicit enrichment during his brother's 1988-1994 term. Carlos Salinas fled Mexico soon after his term ended and now lives in self-imposed exile in Ireland.
Salinas has denied the charges and said his vast wealth came from legitimate business negotiations in Mexico.
